sec.p: Sophisticated dynamical ice sheet models are used to estimate future Greenland mass changes resulting from modified SMB and ice flow [ 26, 27, 28•, 29, 30]. These models can be run either in standalone mode with prescribed climate forcing [ 31•], or within coupled climate models [ 32•, 33]. The models are validated by comparison to observed ice sheet area, thickness, and velocity, and are starting to be used to hindcast recent changes [ 34•]. Computer models can also simulate aggregated mass losses from the Earth’s glaciers [ 35]. Compared to ice sheet models, global glacier models typically have simplified dynamics, focusing on SMB changes or process understanding.
